intro: Erodium iranicum, commonly known as Persian bird's-beak, is a flowering plant native to Iran and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many nitrogen-fixing plants. The plant is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Erodium iranicum typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showing a high degree of adaptability to dry conditions.
